data.value: Calculate quantiles for a probability plot, and optionally show the plot.
Generates a probability plot of sample data against the quantiles of a specified theoretical distribution (the normal distribution by default).
optionally calculates a best-fit line for the data and plots the results using Matplotlib or a given plot function.
Sample/response data from which
creates the plot.
Distribution-specific shape parameters (shape parameters plus location and scale).
Distribution or distribution function name. The default is 'norm' for a normal probability plot.  Objects that look enough like a stats.distributions instance (i.e. they have a
method) are also accepted.
Fit a least-squares regression (best-fit) line to the sample data if True (default).
If given, plots the quantiles and least squares fit.
is an object that has to have methods "plot" and "text". The
module or a Matplotlib Axes object can be used, or a custom object with the same methods. Default is None, which means that no plot is created.
Tuple of theoretical quantiles (osm, or order statistic medians) and ordered responses (osr).
is simply sorted input
. For details on how
is calculated see the Notes section.
Tuple  containing the result of the least-squares fit, if that is performed by
is the square root of the coefficient of determination.  If
and
, this tuple is not returned.
